official_title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that the President should award the Presidential Medal of Freedom to Charles E.  Thornton, Lee Shapiro, and Jim Lindelof, citizens of the United States who were killed in Afghanistan.

summary.text: Declares that the President should: (1) posthumously award the Presidential Medal of Freedom to Charles E. Thornton, Lee Shapiro, and Jim Lindelof in honor of their efforts to document the Afghan struggle for freedom; and (2) present the award to those individuals' families on March 21, 1988, the start of the new year in Afghanistan.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that the President should award the Presidential Medal of Freedom to Charles E.  Thornton, Lee Shapiro, and Jim Lindelof, citizens of the United States who were killed in Afghanistan.
